summary: This is an internal email chain among prosecutors from the Southern District of New York, dated November-December 2020, outlining a task list for trial preparation in the Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details planned witness interviews, evidence authentication, and investigative steps, revealing the prosecution's strategy and pending actions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' throughout the document; the prosecution is reviewing her emails and deposition transcripts as part of trial preparation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of donor relations; a retired employee who managed relations with him is sought to authenticate documents.

persons.name: Sigrid
persons.context: A person (likely a witness or associate) whom a prosecutor plans to call about a potential interview.

connections.description: The prosecution's case preparation, including reviewing Maxwell's emails and seeking authentication of Epstein-related documents, indicates their alleged joint criminal activity.

events.title: Prosecution Team Agenda Meeting
events.description: An email is sent to the prosecution team listing topics for discussion regarding next steps in trial preparation for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Task List Finalization
events.description: A follow-up email is sent with a detailed task list for the prosecution team, based on a prior conversation, outlining investigative and interview steps.

events.title: Status Check on Trial Prep
events.description: A prosecutor checks in on the task list, noting completed or in-motion items related to evidence review, witness interviews, and authentication.

locations: PB house (likely referring to a property in Palm Beach)
keyFacts: The prosecution team was actively preparing for trial in late 2020, with a detailed task list covering evidence review, witness interviews, and authentication.

Key tasks included reviewing Ghislaine Maxwell's emails via Relativity, identifying a retired employee who managed donor relations with Jeffrey Epstein, and authenticating items from a search of a Palm Beach house.
The document references multiple planned or potential interviews with various individuals (many names redacted), including victims, witnesses, and a client, indicating a broad investigative scope.
The prosecution noted the statute of limitations (SOL) was approaching regarding the review of Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition transcripts.
The email chain reveals coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and federal agents to conduct interviews and follow up on tip-line leads.
